samples.name: Flow Chart
samples.description: This sample visualizes the processing of an order placed using credit card with built-in flow shapes.

samples.name: Nodes
samples.description: This sample visualizes the different stages of a software development life cycle using a circular flow diagram.

samples.name: Shapes
samples.description: This sample illustrates list of built-in shapes available in our JavaScript Diagram Library which includes basic shapes, flow shapes, and BPMN shapes.

samples.name: HTML Shapes
samples.description: This sample demonstrates how to host a HTML element inside a node. In this example, a Gauge control is hosted inside a HTML Node.

samples.name: Connectors
samples.description: This sample visualizes the data flow in a marketing process using predefined diagram shapes and connectors.

samples.name: Line Routing
samples.description: This sample visualizes the connectors that are automatically re-routing or moving away if any shape found on the connectors path.

samples.name: Avoid Connector Overlap
samples.description: This sample visualizes the connectors that automatically adjust to minimize visual overlap, ensuring clear and distinct representations of connections within the diagram.

samples.name: Annotations
samples.description: This sample illustrates the competitive environment of a business through five forces chart and its described using nodes and annotations.

samples.name: Ports
samples.description: This sample visualizes process flow of publishing a book using connection points which are static points over shapes that allow creating connections onto it.

samples.name: Swimlane
samples.description: This sample  Different types of connectors and decorators are used to customize the appearance, path, and direction of the data flow.

samples.name: Grouping and Ordering
samples.description: This sample illustrates how to group, ungroup, and order commands with the diagram.

samples.name: Events
samples.description: This sample visualizes what are the client side events are available in our JavaScript Diagram Library.

samples.name: History Manager
samples.description: This sample  Different types of connectors and decorators are used to customize the appearance, path, and direction of the data flow.

samples.name: Commands
samples.description: This example illustrates the various commands supported in the diagram control.

samples.name: Constraints
samples.description: This sample illustrates how node constraints are used to restrict end-users from performing certain operations on nodes and connector constraints are used to restrict end-users from performing certain operation on connectors.

samples.name: Tooltip
samples.description: This sample demonstrates how to add the extra information to the nodes and connectors and how to show the information through diagram's tooltip feature.

samples.name: Symbol Palette
samples.description: This example illustrates predefining shapes in a palette that can be easily dragged and dropped into the drawing area.

samples.name: Zooming and Panning
samples.description: This sample illustrates how to zoom and pan in the diagram.

samples.name: Snapping
samples.description: This sample shows how diagram objects snap to the nearest intersection of gridlines or objects while being dragged or resized.

samples.name: Scrolling
samples.description: This example illustrates how to scroll a diagram using vertical and horizontal scrollbars. The scroll limit property helps limit the scrolling area.

samples.name: Drawing Tools
samples.description: This sample visualizes how to build a diagram interactively using drawing tools. Continuous draw option, snapping are enabled to easily draw diagrams.

samples.name: Keyboard Interaction
samples.description: This sample illustrates interaction with diagram control using shortcut keys. Command Manager support is used to manage keyboard interactions.

samples.name: User Handles
samples.description: This sample visualizes a simple flow diagram along with options to execute the frequently used commands using user handles.

samples.name: Overview
samples.description: This sample visualizes an organizational structure along with an overview for easily navigating the large organizational structure using Overview Panel.

samples.name: Organizational Chart
samples.description: This sample illustrates a simple business management structure that is built from an external data source.

samples.name: Flowchart Layout
samples.description: This sample illustrates the flowchart layout algorithm that is used to automatically arrange the flow shapes.

samples.name: Mind Map
samples.description: This sample demonstrates the concept of creativity using mind map layout algorithm. User handles are used to extend the mind map interactively.

samples.name: Hierarchical Tree
samples.description: This sample illustrates a generating hierarchical tree from right to left orientation with external data source.

samples.name: Complex Hierarchical Tree
samples.description: This sample demonstrates a complex hierarchical template that is built from an external data source using complex hierarchical tree algorithm.

samples.name: Radial Tree
samples.description: This sample demonstrates a huge organizational structure using a compact layout model. Radial tree layout algorithm is used to build such a layout.

samples.name: Symmetric Layout
samples.description: This sample visualizes a simple network template using symmetrical layout algorithm. It uses attractive and repulsive forces.

samples.name: RTL Tree
samples.description: This sample visualizes the concept of Artificical Intelligence using hierarchical tree layout algorithm

samples.name: PERT chart
samples.description: This sample visualizes a project development process using Program Evaluation Review Technique (PERT).

samples.name: Hierarchical Layout with multiple roots
samples.description: This sample illustrates the structure of an Electricity Sector using complex hierarchical layout with multiple roots.

samples.name: Local Data
samples.description: This sample visualizes the classifications of species using hierarchical tree layout algorithm. Data Manager support is used to bind data with the diagram.

samples.name: Remote Data
samples.description: This sample demonstrates how to bind an remote data with the diagram using the Data Manager support.

samples.name: Virtualization
samples.description: This sample demonstrates the default UI virtualization functionality. Scroll the diagram for UI virtualization.

samples.name: Serialization
samples.description: This sample visualizes building diagrams interactively and editing the saved diagrams. Symbol Palette is used to easily build diagrams.

samples.name: Export and Print
samples.description: This example shows how to print the diagram and how to export the diagram as image (*.jpg, *.png) and SVG format.

samples.name: BPMN Editor
samples.description: This sample visualizes the hotel booking reservation system and its built with ready made BPMN shapes.

samples.name: Logic Circuit Diagram
samples.description: This sample visualizes implementation of three input Boolean functions using universal logic gates and shape for logic gates designed with diagram's path node.

samples.name: UML Activity Diagram
samples.description: This sample visually represents the hotel booking reservation system. It is built with readymade BPMN shapes.

samples.name: UML Sequence Diagram
samples.description: This sample illustrates an employee’s leave request sequence using a UML sequence diagram. The shapes for the sequence were designed with the port feature for Diagram's nodes.

samples.name: UML Class Diagram
samples.description: This sample represents the hospital management system using diagram's built-in UML class diagram shapes.

samples.name: Venn Diagram
samples.description: This sample visually represents the hotel booking reservation system. It is built with readymade BPMN shapes.

samples.name: Network Diagram
samples.description: This sample visualizes graphical layout of a network diagram using diagram's Native(SVG) nodes feature.

samples.name: Fishbone Diagram
samples.description: This sample visually represents a simple fishbone diagram (Ishikawa). Diagram nodes and annotations are used to define fishbone diagrams.

samples.name: Workflow Diagram
samples.description: This sample visually represents a simple Workflow of a Travel Request Agency using Syncfusion<sup>®</sup> EJ2 TypeScript. The diagram includes BPMN nodes, connectors, and annotations to represent various diagram objects.

samples.name: Diagram Binding with TreeView
samples.description: This example illustrates how to create a tree view and a diagram with a datasource. It provides support for selecting, adding, deleting, dragging and dropping, and editing annotations of the nodes during runtime. These actions will be reflected in the corresponding nodes of the tree view component.

samples.name: Flow Execution
samples.description: This sample  Different types of connectors and decorators are used to customize the appearance, path, and direction of the data flow.
